column5: Ah, piece of cake.  Look, the birds are fine  Joey
Heck.. I'd just launch right there... IN the park !
wonder if the fish are biting
Boat's at the door Terry... wanna go?
I would love to   but I have something in the oven
WOW..man thats sure wicked weather for sure !!!!   ...you would not even stand a chance out there,those waves are huge man !!!!    thanks for sharing
Thats some scary weather...waves, wind and wice.  I mean ice.  "normally we head to the pier that is underwater over there....its just ankle deep in water"  Is there softwater fishing all year round?
It's the Niagara river at the mouth of Erie, she is roaring!
Makes one wonder, how the fish handle that. Being tossed around.  Thats nasty forsure.
wow that is a rocking river for sure!  Cheers!
Couple from my side of the pond looking out from the small boat harbor      That is the bird island pier that you would normally be able to take a pleasant stroll out on....yeah its under water
Take the word "dare" out of your post before Cudz heads out there with his tinnie!

I was up to the point (L.Ont.)yesterday around noon. Had to lean into the wind to walk and my hands were cold enough to fall off in a minute. Waves weren't real high but they were breaking everywhere.

that keeps up Chilli, and we can launch the boat from my driveway soon   , I am glad I already caught some respectable fish this December because I am itchin to get out big time....once this clears up and the river is green again the fishing is going to be just nuts.  specially since everything in Lake Erie, and the Upper River just got spilled over to the Lower River, so now there are about 10 million more fish on the Lower
